- Preston

On 6/22/11, adamsafran <adamsafran@...> wrote:
> Requesting the character of Wheelie, going back along with Leos' crew to
> pastoral Earth.  Can be one of the reinforcements and such sent in.
>
> WHEELIE
>
> Faction: Autobot/Maximal
>
> QUOTE:  Look there, over there!  Friends find, look behind!
>
> PROFILE:  An Autobot by the name of Wheelie grew up on a crashed ship,
> surviving for an unkonwn period of time on Quintessa.  Found by Autobots
> during the first Unicron crisis, he soon joined them and was a stalwart 
> part
> of their forces going alon gwith the first Maximal Imperium after the war.
> A loner often forming strong bonds adn freindships and with a unique sort 
> of
> personality from his time spent in isolation and having to fight to 
> survive,
> Wheelie is often accompanied by his scrounger friend Gnaw, operating with
> local groups that cna tolerate his infmay as he moves on.
>
> ABILITIES:  A permanent glitch in his vocal processor developed by his 
> long
> period in isolation upon Quintessa, Wheelie's vocalizer tends to vocalize 
> in
> ways in whatever linguistic dialect that are often translated as 'rhymes'.
> These tend to be high pitched, grating, and annoying, and prolonged 
> exposure
> is held to be extremely damaging to one's circuits, much like Cosmic Rust
> and Fire Suppressant Foam.  As such, the sight (or sound) of Wheelie on 
> the
> battlefield is often enough to drive many Predacons or Decepticons to flee
> and abandon the area.
>
> Wheelie is armed with a small energon slingshot with a close range high
> capacity load that is capable of inflicting significant damage on larger
> Cybertronians.  His small alt mode of a Cybertronian racer has a top speed
> of 180 kilometers per hour and a range of over three thousand kilometers.
> Wheelie himself is heavily energon efficient, even by Maximal standard, 
> and
> his bodyframe is capable of extended independent functioning without
> refueling or repairs (which is the way many Maximals would profess to like
> it), and is quite simplistic to maintain that even Wheelie can keep 
> himself
> basically functional without medical supervision.  His small bodyframe is
> also quite agile and difficult to hit, combined with his long vorns spent 
> of
> surviving have made him quite surprisingly adept at escape and evasion,
> guerilla operations, and reconaissance in urban or organic areas.
>
>
> Weaknesses:  Wheelie has much of a reputation, deserved or not, among
> Autobots and Decepticons.  While he can count some as staunch friends, his
> ability to seemingly inflict insanity to those in constant presence of his
> chattering has made many Autobots and Maximals wish to avoid prolonged
> interactions with him, and can lead to his constant solo operations in the
> field without backup.  This has also lead to a constant but 
> unsubstantiated
> threats of violence to be inflicted upon him by his own faction, depending
> on how casual the company is.
>
> Wheelie's form, while agile, is very small and very vulnerable, and lacks
> power.  He is weak physically, and his primary weapon (an energon 
> slingshot)
> has a very limited range, and even low powered energy weapons can inflict
> significant damage upon him.  In a hand to hand fight he is seriously
> vulnerable to damage and can take few hits.
>
>
> History:  Wheelie spent unknown thousands of vorns as the only survivor of 
> a
> crashed ship upon Quintessa, where upon his rescue he became a stalwart 
> part
> of the AUtobot forces, most often operating on long range reconaissance
> missions or as backup to his friends.  After the Autobot/Decepticon War
> ended, and many of his friends went into retirement, Wheelie was not
> upgraded along with teh initial wave of Maximal upgrading, preferring to
> keep his original body as a memory to those whom had been lost in the war.
>
> Pending the end of the war, Wheelie's whereabouts became much fo a 
> mystery,
> with various stories at any point theorizing he had been killed in a back
> alley by Autobot/Decepticons (most often accompanied by 'I'LL DRINK TO
> THAT!' in Maccadam's) to that he was working with th Maximal Security
> Administration.  One theroy even stated that he had been part of the 
> Maximal
> Experimentation Program that had produced Protoform X, simply stating that
> he was what had driven the unit that would eventually call itself Rampage 
> to
> total sociopathy and nihilism simply from being locked in a cell for the
> experiments!  Many would explain their decline to believe in Primus by
> saying 'He made that guy, didn't he?' and gesture to the MiniBot.
>
> (Un)fortunately, Wheelie has been still functioning over the era, living 
> on
> Cybertron, often going on trips to search the galaxy and find more
> information.  While there, he would spend much of his time in Little Iacon
> remiscing of the old days.  Upon attemptimg to join a craft, according to
> scuttleaft a Maximal hit upon the idea of sending him along with Leo's
> reinforcement crew to Earth.
>
> Further scuttleaft was hoping that by sending him several tens of 
> thousands
> of vorns back in time and to active military conflict would 'get the 
> little
> cans to be recycled', but were never actively confirmed as transfer orders
> were sent.
>
>
>
>
>
